alert.note: Alert for Pueblo (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 09 at 1:11AM MST until February 09 at 2:00AM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northwestern Pueblo County in southeastern Colorado... * Until 200 AM MST. * At 109 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located near Pueblo, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 50 mph could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This snow squall will affect the Pueblo area. Locations impacted include... Pueblo, Pueblo West, Pueblo Reservoir, Salt Creek and Blende. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
